descriptionMarkdown:
Do your Kovarex builds take too long before they produce the first fuel cells?   Trying to improve them you want to place exactly 40 into the first centrifuge and immediately make the rest available for fuel cells, but you got frustrated by how hard it is to make that critical counter?  

Fear no more!  This test rig not only shows you how to build it, it makes it easy to understand!

REQUIREMENTS:

- The blue inserter takes exactly 40 U-235 from the mainline chest on the right, incrementing a counter.
- The 40 U-235 are fed into the centrifuge.  Simulated in the test rig by the left chest so that you can inspect it easier.
- When the Kovarex cycle is complete, it releases the 40 U-235 and at least one U-238 that is typically fed right back into the centrifuge.
- The release of U-238 (purple inserter) triggers  a reset of the counter back to zero, thus making it possible for the blue inserter to start pulling 40 U-235.

DESIGN:

- The U-238 constant combinator lets you simulate the purple inserter behavior by turning the combinator on then off.  When it is on it generates a U-238 signal and turns on the red lamp to indicate that the blue inserter should NOT operate.
- The top combinator simply gives a green signal (and turns on the top lamp) when the purple inserter/combinator has no U-235.
- The bottom left combinator counts U-235 pulses from the blue inserter moving a piece of U-235, but ONLY if the U-238 signal is 0.  That means when the purple inserter unloads from the centrifuge (or you simulate it with the constant combinator by turning it on then off)   it resets the counter back to zero.
- The count of U-235 is passed to the bottom right combinator, which generates a green signal (and turns on the bottom right light) when U-235 count is less than 40.  
- If both green signals (U-238=0 and U-235 <40) are on, the blue inserter gets enabled.

NOTE:   Use another inserter to remove U-235 and send it to the rest of your build (i.e.: make fuel cells or other centrifuges) when GREEN < 2.  Why?  Because GREEN = 2 from the beginning until 40 are counted, then drops to < 2 so at that time it is safe to extract excess U-235 without risking your core 40.  And once the centrifuge releases the 40 U-235 it goes to GREEN=2 again until it counts 40.

EXAMPLE:  

This design is used to feed the bottom centrifuge in the following blueprint:  https://factorioprints.com/view/-LbR6oDvcyQDLsSuyv_C.  The excess U-235 feeds the Fuel Cell assembler and the other 3 Kovarex centrifuges.  The first centrifuge always has priority for the first 40 U-235.
title: Bulldog Starter Kovarex 40-count test rig
